amendment.description: To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund related to sexual assault at institutions of higher education, which may include the implementation of an independent and standardized online survey tool developed and administered by the Department of Education, in consultation with the Department of Justice, to measure the prevalence of sexual assault at institutions of higher education.

vote.text: Amendment SA 520 agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Amendment SA 520 proposed by Senator Sanders for Senator Gillibrand. (consideration: CR 3/26/2015 S2014-2022; text: CR 3/26/2015 S2019-2020) To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund related to sexual assault at institutions of higher education, which may include the implementation of an independent and standardized online survey tool developed and administered by the Department of Education, in consultation with the Department of Justice, to measure the prevalence of sexual assault at institutions of higher education.
Senate amendment agreed to: Amendment SA 520 agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.
